[THIS REVIEW CONTAINS SPOILERS]
(At Nomad Studios)
Director [sighing]: Creativity is dying in the anime industry.  Specifically, in the harem genre, we already have harems that involve twins, monster girls, cans transforming into girls, girls from outer space, girls with magical powers, etc. The list goes on. Is there anything we haven’t done?
Producer: H’m…oh, I believe there’s one light novel that we haven’t adapted. And it’s unique.
Director [looks at producer]: Well, what is it? What’s the title?
Producer [pulling the light novel from his bag]: It’s titled, “Kampfer."
Director [confused]: Kampfer? Why is the title in German?
Producer [shrugging his shoulders]: I don’t know. But, I know the authorused many German words. Maybe, he was a fan of the German language? Or its culture? But, who cares.


Director: Okay, so what’s it about?


Producer [reading the back cover of the light novel]: It’s about a boy named Natsuru Senou, who wakes up one day, and discovers that he’s a girl. A stuffed tiger, in his room, comes to life and informs him that he’s become a Kampfer, a female fighter. Moreover, all Kampfers must fight other Kampfers, and so begins the story of Natsuru as a female fighter.


Director: Wait. Is it similar to TSF Monogatari? I mean, does the protagonist like both girls and guys?


Producer [shocked]: Definitely not! Natsuru only likes girls, both in his male and female forms.


Director: I see. No…wait a minute. If Natsuru is in his female form, and Natsuru only likes females, regardless of his gender, doesn’t that mean he’s a lesbian?


Producer: Well…technically that’s correct. But, I’m pretty sure, the male viewers would not mind, girl on girl action. Even if, one of the girls is technically a guy.


Director [nodding]: Okay. So, about the girls, do they like Natsuru in both his male and female forms? And if so, wouldn’t that make them bisexual?


Producer: Unfortunately, none of the main and side girls are bisexual. Although, all of the girls, including the boys, love Natsuru’s female form to the point of being called a “School Beauty.” There’s one main girl, I believe her name is Kaede Sakura, who is a lesbian and falls in love with Natsuru’s female form. Now, the other main girls (i.e. childhood friend, student council president, and glasses girl) fall in love with Natsuru in his male form. Quite typical, really.


Director [shaking his head]: Damn it! That would have been awesome and unique. A lesbian main character hooking up with a bunch bisexual girls, I wouldn’t even complain! [Sighing.] Oh, well…let me read the first couple of light novels and I’ll tell you how I feel.


Producer: Sure. [He hands the Director the first four novels for Kampfer.]


Director: Thanks. I’ll read them, thoroughly.


[One week later]


Producer: So, how was it?


Director: It was good…at first. There were many action scenes, and they were cool. I mean, red kampfers vs. blue kampfers. Guns, swords, and magic. And tons of explosions. [Sighing.] But, then it turned into a romantic comedy filled with typical events, such as the cultural festival, pools, maid cafe, beauty contest, and summer festival. Besides, those events, what’s up with the protagonist and suggestive clothing, he has worn: school swimsuits, bunny suit, nurse, bloomers, maid, and a naked apron. Doesn’t he care about his current appearances?


Producer: I’m sure, our protagonist does care about his appearance, but the girls and mostly the situations he’s in, force him to dress in women’s clothing.


Director: Well, I understand his situation, but it just seems all forced, like it was mainly for fanservice. And speaking of fanservice…there’s a lot of ripped clothes, nudity, suggestive collisions, and boob and ass moments.


Producer: Pandering to the readers, and, of course, to our future viewers.


Director [shrugging]: Well, fanservice is fanservice, although there is one thing that irks me. 


Producer: And, what is that?


Director: Why are the red and blue kampfers fighting each other? I understand many characters throughout the story ask the messengers this question, but they always dodge or ignore it entirely. But, it isn’t just that question, but also, "who makes them fight", and "why did Natsuru and the girls get their abilities." This makes each fight seem random and pointless.


Producer: I understand your frustration, and I’m sure the author will answer those questions. 


Director: Speaking of questions…how many light novels in this series has the author written?


Producer: The author has written nine light novel for this series, and is preparing for more in the future.


Director [shaking his head]: That’s not good. If what you said is correct, then there isn’t a conclusive ending, which means…


Producer: That Natsuru hasn’t chosen a girl, yet. Shit! What are we going to do? What type of ending should we go for?


Director: We could go with, “The Story Continues”, or “No Romantic Resolution” or “Harem Ending”, but all these endings will piss off some portion of the audience. [Thinking. Suddenly, he snaps his fingers.] I got it! Since, this series is getting 12 episodes max, and the final episode ends one week before Christmas. Let’s make a Christmas Episode.


Producer: Brilliant Idea! But, let’s not produce your typical Christmas Episode, but one with a twist.


Director: H’m…I like it. Let’s go with it.


Producer: Okay. I’ll begin production, right away.


The End

Kampfer: The story of a boy who discovers he has gained the ability to transform into a fireball-throwing female warrior.
I didn't expect anything from the first episode to be honest. I was ready for a poor anime from the start. Thankfully, it managed to improve a little bit in my eyes before it wrapped up at episode 11 (12? Don't ask...).
Story-It has an interesting premise: random people with bizarre bracelets have the power to transform into either sword-flinging, gun-slinging or fireball-blasting amazons. These amazons, split up into the classic Red vs. Blue style team battle, are fighting for unknown reasons, only by the whim ofmysterious figures known as "Moderators."


Unfortunately, it doesn't really fulfill that idea. Only a few action scenes, and they tend to be short-lived. There really isn't an epic fight that managed to grab my attention throughout the whole show. Also, it seemed that this story was only an excuse for the excessive ecchi elements of this show: nothing better than a bunch of large-chest women duking it out in school uniforms.


A bigger point of the story are the romantic elements, although these weren't exactly spectacular either. Without revealing anything in the show, there was very little development in whatever psuedo-relationship this show tried to pull, and most of these relationships again seemed to be excuses for more ecchi content by appealing to numerous interests.


This show also doesn't do a good job of wrapping up details. At least right now it appears unlikely that there will be a second season, and if so Kampfer failed to address many of the questions I had for it.


So, overall the story seemed original, but it wasn't very well executed.


Art & Sound-Visually pleasing. There is nothing outstanding or groundbreaking, but there's nothing to complain about. Soundwise, they did a decent job too, a little bit more than I expected.


Character-Some of the characters in this anime do have their good points. One warrior upon transformation completely flips, which I found amusing watching the contrast and wondering if it really was the same person. It was also good fun to watch the main star's issues as he tried to adjust to having a woman's body.


It doesn't get better than that for the humans, however. All the rest of them are actually quite shallow with very little personality.  Sure, they all have their "role," but they go no further. They all have a very clear objective from start to finish, and nothing's changing anytime soon. There are a couple of personality shifts, but they are hardly interesting.


There's another set of characters that are probably the biggest reason I kept watching this: each of these warriors get an animal doll with some sort of physical obscenity; usually it's the intestines sticking out. These things are animated, however, and they do not take this whole Red vs. Blue thing seriously at all. They were tons of fun in my opinion, and they managed to make the show a lot better.


Enjoyment-Alright, with all the crud I said about this show, I admit I didn't hate every single minute of it. I was disappointed as I learned that it was not going uphill, but at the same time it wasn't all downhill either. I had fun watching this.


Overall-I doubt I'll be watching this again, and I don't think I'll be bothered by looking for the second season. I probably won't recommend this to anyone I know.


This show is good for the ecchi, and it does have its moments. But overall this is something I won't be remembering.


6/10-Fair

Natsuru is a normal high school boy, aside from the fact that one day he wakes up as a big-breasted girl. An Entrails Animal in the shape of a plush tiger with its intestines hanging out, named Harakiri Tora (Disemboweled Tiger), informs Natsuru that he has become a Kämpfer and must now fight against other Kämpfers for what initially seems like no reason.
The first episode starts off with a bang; Kämpfer seems like a nice comedy/action series with a little bit of gender bending and even a love story between Natsuru and a soft-spoken girl named Kaede tossed in.
Everything great about this series quickly degenerates,though, so soon as episode 3, when it becomes a yuri love-fest –– male Natsuru, trapped in his female Kämpfer body, stuck between it all.


And that basically sums up most of the series. Kämpfer, to some fans’ delight, started out looking like another Sekirei, but instead resorted to perverted jokes and fan service à la Rosario + Vampire.


Story

-----------------------

Kämpfer, for the most part, has no story, unless you count the yuri love triangle –– er, square –– that persists every episode, which the anime makes no attempt to underplay. What few battle scenes there are only last a minute at most and are definitely not worth the weeks of waiting that it took to get there. I’m glad I held out and marathoned the last 5 episodes. In my opinion, the most interesting twist occurs at episode 7. Unfortunately, the series ended quite open-endedly, which only hints that we’re doomed to get a second season.


Art

-----------------------

The art quality from Kämpfer is inconsistent from time to time. The animation can be sharp and glowly during the more dramatic and intense scenes –– I especially like the depth of field effect when a character is near the foreground –– while sometimes there are obvious mistakes in subtle places that  people too focused on the fan service may not notice. For example, in one infamous scene, a chair in the bathroom has no reflection in the mirror. These failures in quality control may come as no surprise, though, since this anime is produced by Nomad, who got caught putting six fingers on Suigintou in Rozen Maiden.


Sound

-----------------------

The sound was okay at best and annoying at worst. Natsuru’s male voice was especially ear-wrenching –– makes sense, since he is voiced by female voice actress Marina Inoue (also known for Chiri Kitsu in Zetsubou Sensei). I’ll admit, though, that Natsuru in female form sounded really cute. You may be ecstatic to hear that Kämpfer hosts a plethora of talented voice actresses, mainly coming in the form of the small Entrails Animals. We have the voice actresses of Kotomi Ichinose and Mei Sunohara from Clannad, and my personal favorite, Yui Horie, plays the role of Natsuru’s friend, Akane Mishima. It’s just too bad that all that talent had to go to waste on a series that most people won’t care about a year from now. The OP and ED theme are pretty good, assuming you like bubbly J-pop music. I found the ED theme quite addicting.


Character

-----------------------

The characters in Kämpfer are blatantly generic; you would almost think the producers did it on purpose. Akane is a shy and cute meganekko who transforms into a sour-mouthed Kämpfer with no sympathy whatsoever. Shizuku Sangou is president of the Student Council and, despite her harsh demeanor, has deep passion for Natsuru. Kaede Sakura is the most annoying, in my opinion. I hated her from beginning to end. It’s her selfish personality that really bothered me. She only likes the female version of Natsuru, despite male Natsuru’s love for her.  Natsuru’s expressions are cute and funny when he’s a Kämpfer, although he still gets embarrassed a lot, even in his male form.


Enjoyment

-----------------------

You’re enjoyment will depend on how much you like gender bending, fan service, and especially yuri. There is a lot of kissing and groping in this anime, but not so much that it would be considered borderline hentai like Kanokon. If you’re looking for action in this series, you’re going to be quite frustrated by the lack of it. I guess the only way you could enjoy this show is if you have a tolerance for the all the awkward situations Natsuru falls in with his female friends and classmates flocking to get their hands on his/her busty body. I’ll give you a fair warning and say that Kämpfer comes no where near the quality of Rozen Maiden –– one of Nomad’s other anime. In fact, I would say I liked Kämpfer only slightly better than Akikan! because of its gender bendingness. 


Overall

-----------------------

Kämpfer doesn’t break any molds or tries to reinvent the genre. Sure, a guy stuck in a girl’s body is an interesting scenario, but the anime fails to do anything with it, besides having other females literally fight over him…I mean, her. The Entrails Animals were humorous, arguably more than their Kämpers, but we don’t get much of an insight into their personality –– aside from a few one-liners –– until the final episode, which has no relevance to the rest of the series. Kämpfer isn’t necessarily an awful series –– it’s definitely unique from the other forgetful ecchi series out there. The reason it fails is because the first two episodes promise so much potential, but the series totally ends up denying the audience’s expectations, in the end. Kämpfer brings a whole new meaning to the phrase “Don’t judge an anime by its first episode.”

Synopsis:
Senou Natsuru is your normal, everyday high school student. However he´s been chosen to be a Kampfer, who´s objective consists on fighting other Kampfer with either guns, swords or magic, however, there´s catch; first you can´t chose if you´re a Kampfer or not, and second, you must have the body of a girl to use your powers.
Plot:
“Whether or not you want to be a Kampfer is irrelevant, you are chosen and have to fight. Lastly, to use your abilities as a Kampfer, you must have a girl’s body.” These are all rules that were thrust upon a poor high school student named Natsuru Senou. Asthe days go by, his life complicates even further as he is forced to live a life as a girl and try to figure out why everyone around him is turning out to be a die hard lesbian!!!!


Characters:

Natsuru Senou – the protagonist of the anime. He woke one day in a girl’s body and on his way to school was attacked by a mysterious girl with a gun where he transformed into his female self once again.. His long time crush, Sakura Kaede, falls in love with his female self and this starts a wheel of unfortunate events for our hero(ine). Natsuru wears a blue Kampfer bracelet and wields Zauber type battle capabilities based on fire.

Akane Mishima – the mysterious girl that attacked Natsuru on the day of his Kampfer-ing. She is usually very kind but when in her Kampfer form, she becomes very foul mouthed and proceeds to shoot first and ask questions later. She is a Gewehr type Kampfer who uses a semiautomatic handgun.

Sakura Kaede – Natsuru’s childhood friend. She falls in love with his Kampfer form and begins a relentless pursuit of his love. Also, she has a fondness for the Entrails Animals series of stuffed animals and gives them out as gifts. Strangely enough, everyone to receive an Entrails Animal from her becomes a Kampfer…


Sound & Graphics:

The music in this anime is very upbeat keeping with the entire all-girl cast. The music utilises artists such as Minami Kuribayashi and Megumi Nakajima in the OP and ED respectively. The seiyuu are all also all stars with voices like Nana Mizuki, Yui Horie and Yukari Tamura. The animation in itself uses bright colours again keeping with the feminine aspect and the characters all have their kawaii appearances and the transformation scenes (when shown remind you of the old time scenes from Sailor Moon).


Entertainment & Replay Value:

Really one of the anime that I wait for with my fangirl squeal each week. I can’t wait for the episodes to come out and when they do, I can’t wait to watch them. There are times that I ask myself if this is an action anime because the action isn’t so prominent but when fights come around, they please the audience. Also, since this revolves around mainly female characters, there is obviously a heavy dose of yuri here. Shoujo and yuri fans will be greatly entertained

The plot.....I think I'm still trying to find it. This was nothing but a poorly done fan service. Oh and if you want something with a conclusion this is not it.
The Animals made no sense to me. What was the point of the animals with the entrailshanging out? Was it to have some kind of creepy factor?\n\n

Opening Thoughts: Kampfer are girls with big breasts that fight against each other for no reason whatsoever, except that someone called "The Moderators" have chosen them to particpate in the fight between each which are relayed in messages by stuffed animals. A rather ridiculous concept isn't it? If you couldn't tell already, this is a ecchi/harem anime, that pretty much takes everything from the harem manual, with sterotypes of pretty much every kind of character you can think of.
Plot: The plot isn't the strong side of the show, considering that the plot was pretty much nonexsistent until episode 9, and by then, everyone was justexpecting more random comical fanservice like in the previous 6 episodes. But I will tell you what little of the plot there is anyways, Big-breasted babes are chosen by the moderators to fight against each other in teams of red vs blue, with no alterior motive, later on the motive is revealed to be a continuation of a fight from a distant galaxy, which no one knows what started the war nor care, and to settle this they decided to continue the fight on earth, while under the watch of the moderators. But in my opinion is just an excuse for the main character, Natsuru to transform into a girl and perform other ecchi related content. The only other premise of the episodes are natsuru trying to win his crush, Sakura to fall head over heels for his boy side, but since she is obviously lesbian, that will never happen, while he also has 3 hot babes just waiting to fuck with him on his male side but is too stupid to notice. SPOILER ALERT: The final plot twist of the series (excuse me, the only one) is that his lesbian companion, Sakura is actually working for the moderators, and she wants Natsuru to join the moderators on his female side and kill the other supporting characters. The ending was a bit dissapointing, as no one died and the action was little to none. 1/10


Characters: The character development of Kampfer wasn't that fantastic, but all of the characters were absouletly comical and all of which participated in fanservice of some kind. The characters were very sterotypical harem anime characters, but It was quite amusing watching one of the supporting characters, Akane, missing every shot she fired with her pistol throughout the entire series, which brings me to the characters transformations into kampfers themselves, Akane, a nerdy shy girl with glasses, turns into a total bitch that threatens everyone around her with her pistol and most of the time scaring the living crap out of natsuru, other stereotypical characters include, Mikoto a childhood freind, and Shizuku, a hot student council president who happens to be in love with Natsuru. Another thing about shizuku is, when she transforms the only thing that change is that her inner hair gets white, very dissapointing but other than the actual character development itself, all of the characters throughout the show were dropdead funny, and is impossible not to laugh at them. 7/10


Entertainment Value: The entertainment level of kampfer is so good, it almost covers up all of the epically fail mistakes and nonexsitent plot within the show, the level of ecchi this show has is top notch, and pretty much is the only thing you are going to get, along with natsuru's ignorance to 3 sexy bitches trying to get with him and other comical gags within the show. If you like anime with deep intellectual conversation, millions of plot twists and an actual plot, this anime isnt for you. 10/10


Animation: The animation of Kampfer is superb, not having any animation errors in the show, all of the characters, backgrounds and ecchi are all drawn well. 9/10


Sound: Sound was a bit unbelieveable at times (battle sound effects) but overall the voice actors were excellent and the music was fine aswell. 8/10



Final Thoughts: While the anime itself was extremely amusing, some things just didn't make any sense whatsoever, such as characters slicing through fire, gender transformations and talking stuffed animals, it honestly made the anime very engrossing to watch, While this anime is far from perfect it deserves some props for being very entertaining, and bringing a high level of ecchi onto the table, making it a very good choice for any one who needs a good laugh, but for the lack of plot I sadly will have to take off some major points , but this is one heck of an anime. 7/10

Kampfer is an anime I saw potential at first, but that quickly faded away after the second episode. Basically, it's just full slice of life with stereotypical, bland characters and stupid as shit interactions. I have never seen worse characters ever. The story is there just to bait people, so they can show off what they can do with that R+ rating. Overall, if you're ecchi, fanservice, harem fan who likes protagonists that are stupid as fuck and constantly get pushed around, then this anime is for you, otherwise I don't recommend it. I could only bear it until episode 6-7 and stopped there, it'snot worth going through even if the second part is better.

This anime, although nicely drawn, lacks many aspects that pull the watcher into its world. The sudden start and end of the anime without development gives viewers the impression of trying to write an essay on a book that they are only allowed to read one page from.  It seem to me that the producers tried to fit in too many aspects in only 12 episodes and ended up achieving little.
Story (5/10)
The story is the biggest letdown in the anime. Although it starts out with a good hook, it does not keep up with the expectations viewers have for it. The story revolves aroundNatsuru, a boy who fell in an almost worshipping love for Sakura Kaede. The story starts out with Natsuru waking up as a Kampfer, a girl (such classic Japanese ideas) wearing a blue bracelet, participating in battles against blue bracelet Kampfers for some unknown reason. Along the way, he makes friends and accidentally gets Sakura to fall in love with his female self. At the near end of the series, during a mere time span of 5 minutes, viewers are spurned with some distorted tale of why the Kampfers fight. To me, this reflects inadequate plot development and planning. The producers did not articulate the story and the elements that were introduced and left in the cold. In addition, the ending was so abrupt and pointless that when I asked myself "What did I get from watching these 12 episodes?", my obvious reply was "Nothing." The story incorporates an action part that is sporadically displayed and abruptly ended, making me think that the producers probably ran out of money to continue.

The very last episode certainly left me and probably will leave you wondering "wtf just happened?" 


Character (5/10)

The second biggest letdown is the characters. Although some people like the humorous characters that exhibit a hint of stupidity for comical effects, Natsuru transcends those expectations past the boundary of enjoyment. He is so incredibly dense and intellectually impaired that I could not help facepalming throughout the story. Not only does everyone play him for sucker, he is willing to do almost anything for Sakura out of pure infatuation. Futhermore, all of the other characters also constantly have times where better decisions could have been made. An avid viewer would continually say "Why didn't they do that? It would have avoided ___" throughout the entire story. Although the unpredictable plot is fitting for comedy animes, it does not fit well into the atmosphere of Kampfer. 


Art (9/10)

The best thing about Kampfer is its art. The characters are drawn very beautifully and very anime-like. In addition, the contrast between art of the same characters at different stages of the story caught my attention and induced me to learn from the art style.


Overall, Kampfer is a mediocre display of anime. The great art was what kept me watching, certainly not the plot. In the series, many aspects of school life, love, and are embedded in these 12 episodes. This is also the reason why this anime is not as widely acclaimed as it could have been. Should the producers instead fit that in 24 episodes, Kampfer certainly could have been a better anime. If you're someone who just enjoys an anime with some lol, love, humor,action and has no exceptional emphasis on the presence of a developed plot, this anime might not be bad for you. However, if you're someone who only watches anime with a story and intricate characters, your time could be better spent elsewhere.

OK, this is my first review, but I felt I had to say something.
WTF!
The show started off OK (Ep 1-4). A bit of comedy a bit of action and a bit of ecchi, all fine and dandy. Then ensued a few episodes of 4 horny teen girls trying to get with a teenage boy who didn't get it. He was in love with an evil alien or possibly a human. Let me rephrase that, we have no idea who or what she was because instead of putting an end to the story in the final episode they put a comedy ep without an explanation toANY of the questions the first 11 episodes worked up to.\n\n
This in my book was utter shit, the biggest dissapointment I've had in anime history so far. And I'm up to almost 150 days worth of anime already...

THE LOWDOWN:
Lesbian Anime Highlander is... just kidding. Kampfer is no Highlander. Being disappointed is not an accurate enough description to describe my thoughts for Kampfer, a show that might actually have some promise story-wise, if properly delivered. The story has roughly 10 minutes of airtime in the total 12 episodes. Nobody really fights anything for long, and nothing happens. There is never only One, and there is no facemelter.
It might be possible to use the characters in a slice-of-life comedy, though. It should be considered.
THE GOOD:
The art. The style looks great, and is well animated... and I'm not necessarily talking ecchi. Weapons, when actually involved,are well-designed and portrayed. Locales are well-represented. And the in-show soundtrack is pretty cool, but I'm not particularly fond of either the OP or ED, which is generally surprising.\n\n
THE BAD:\n
Even the smart characters are generally oblivious to everything in existence, and it's horribly stupid and kind of insulting. I would, honestly, be a bit suspicious of a talking doll, no matter how cute its intestines are, or which popular VA voiced it.\n\n
THE UGLY:\n
The story. It kind of ends abruptly as if they ran out of ideas or money, though obviously it's waiting for Season 2. Cue Poochie going back to space.\n\n\n
CHARACTER CHOICES:\n
Kampfer gives you lots of females in bikinis to make note of, but only one regularly-seen male, who isn't always a male, and is a big idiot. Sorry, female fans.\n
I don't think there's a single one in the show that won't sway to vaginas, so it keeps it open for fans who don't like closures of any kind. The maturity of Shizuku, the immaturity (in both forms) of Akane, or the zaniness of Mikoto should at least appeal to one person. Sakura has no real character design because you're not supposed to like her, but rather see her as an obnoxious obstacle.\n
My top character choice is Shizuku. Sexy maturity, is capable of doing stuff, and is pretty smart. Additionally, she kisses like a prostar.\n
If not Shizuku, Akane is fun. She's cute and smart, then turns into a massive badass with a terrible case of potty-mouth, and the aim of a Stormtrooper.\n
Another favorite of mine is the lesser-seen Masumi, because she's got a cute screw loose. But she basically has no role in the show beyond winking hearts everywhere.

Hi! Welcome to another of Robert's Too Late Reviews! As always I assume you have read the synopsis and don't need me to detail what is going on in a general sense with this anime. I'm also sure you've seen the 'overall' number, and are just dying for me to elaborate. Well lets get to it! I came into this anime with very high hopes, as I'm a fan of 'magical girl' type shows, action anime and romances. In fact there isn't much I don't enjoy when done right. Sad to say, Kampfer left me feeling flat andirritated. Pretty obvious Kampfer isn't going to make the incredibly RTLR wall, also there's a note to be had about the manga. Many people who have read it say that the story isn't as atrocious as the anime. Perhaps so, but as a non-reader, I have to judge the show purely for what is presented in the anime. Let's get to why this show left me so unfilled. 


*POSSIBLE SPOILERS even though I try to keep them to a minimum*


Story: 3

I love a zany premise as much as anyone, and was hopeful at the idea of a boy that becomes a girl. I mean, how can that NOT lead to all kinds of awesome moments? Well it immediately begins to come apart with the 'female' version's choice of name. I understand being put on the spot, but that was beyond ridiculous. Moving to the main thrust of the story, we have the proxy war supposedly being fought between these galactic powers, but we are never told why these two supposedly superpowers decided that the proxy war between human Kampfers would even matter. We are never even introduced to anyone from these warring states, if you don't assume the possessed dolls are from them, which there is no reason to make that assumption. We are told that the Red Kampfers are the mortal enemies of the Blue Kampfers (of which our main guy/girl is a reluctant member) but yet other than a couple of intro fights with no clear winners, we have no battling between the groups at all. Another Kampfer color appears as a villain set later, and they are never explained at ALL. Are they from either the Red or Blue empires? Are they a new player in the Empire war? I believe the manga gets into who the new coalition of Kampfers are, but that information is basically omitted from the anime. Why are this new faction controlled by a character who is not a traditional Kampfer as she has no bracelet which until that point of the story means she should not be aware of the Kampfer world whatsoever. The story never explains who she is, why she is evil, and what her dastardly plan really is. It's not even explained who she's representing. It is a plot twist purely for the twist sake, and is groan inducing when it hits.


Art: 9

I LOVED the art in Kampfer, the attention to detail and really nice execution. When the characters do a 'magical girl' transformation scene (which only happens a few times, frustratingly) it is done remarkably well, and looks very good. The quality art just makes the failures even more saddening. 


Sound: 9

I liked the sound. The battles sounded properly, the voice of the guy/girl sounded appropriate to me in each gender, and the foul mouthed Kampfer was a welcome comedic relief with her angry curse-riddled shouting. 


Character: 5

Here we fall on our face. Our boy/girl and his/her unfortunate mistake of naming his female self leads less to shenanigans and more into wondering if everyone in the show are idiots. Also no one seems to question why the new girl just shows up, begins attending class, and living a normal life without one teacher/admin asking her who she is and where she comes from. On the opposite hand, the longer the show goes on, the more time she spends in female form, and no one seems one bit concerned their male friend has apparently disappeared. Sure maybe he didn't have many guy friends, but someone just up and disappearing garners attention, liked or not. The lead red Kampfer also happens to be the student council president (aren't they always?) and instead of busting up the new boy/girl blue Kampfer, she basically falls in love with him/her. The other red follows suit. The other blue also falls a bit, as is expected as the main character is supposed to be her Kampfer partner. We also have weird possessed dolls that serve no purpose at all it would seem, except for mentioning Moderators once or twice, who are of course not explained in any form whatsoever in the entire series. 


Enjoyment: 2

We have a show starting with the promise of the awkwardness of gender swapping combined with rocking action fights. We get basically none of this. The main seems almost immediately comfortable in his female form, and the tired old trope of 'where's the boy' leading to him running and swapping genders, then being asked where the girl is and running back again is trotted out as a 'comedy' bit. We've been seeing that kind of thing forever and a day, in Hollywood, anime, tv, and just about everything else. Shoot, Superman's favorite shtick is Clark Kent always missing on out Superman. A few battles happen, but ultimately our gender bending ass kicker anime devolves into to a lesbian harem with confusing convenient villains who are convenient. The magical girl style animations which would fit so well are barely used, and the ending left me stretching my head wondering exactly what I had just seen, and why the story ended in such an unfulfilling way. 


In closing, no matter how cool Kampfer looks, the last half of the series seems like the writers ran out of ideas and started slinging everything they could at the wall hoping something would stick. Nothing did, including any pictures on the RTLR wall. Pass, trust me.

Hello everybody, this is my review for Kampfer! This is my first review, so please be considerate!
Kampfer is an anime based on the main protagonist, Natsuru Senou.Natsuru wakes up as a Kampfer, which are girls that have special abilities that are made to fight other Kampfers, depending on the color of their bracelets.He is in love with Sakura Kaede, but she has barely even noticed him.  Natsuru turns into a girl randomly and is attack by another Kampfer, Akane. Natsuru saves Sakura from Akane, and Sakura falls in love with the girl Natsuru. The story really turns when Natsuru realizes that he is gonnabe on the same team as Akane. But, when he goes to school, he gets attacked by Shizuku. Shizuku is a red Kampfer, but they make a truce and try to reveal the people pulling the strings, the Moderators.\n
Alright, now after that brief summary, The story now!\n
=====================Story========================\n
For the story, I'd give it a 7. The anime is really interesting if you are into the whole ecchi/harem thing. But, it lacks in a lot of ways. The main story is supposed to be based on the Kampfer and how they have to fight each other, but really the action that the anime seems to entail lacks alot. The anime really falls off later, becoming more focused on the romance aspects instead of the fighting aspects. But, the story  makes that up well with good art, characters, and sound. The ending was decent I guess, definitely not anything heart warming or moving. The last episode however, was almost like a bonus episode. It seemed like it should've been an OVA, and had no place really being an official episode and to me who was really excited at the idea of another episode, it let me down. \n
=====================Art=======================\n
For the art in Kampfer, it's really well done. The art really holds a nice balance with the style of the anime, and personally as an art snob I have to say it met the requirements it takes for me to enjoy an anime. The art flowed well with the action of the anime.\n
======================Sound=====================\n
I believe the voice actors really nailed it on this one. All except, Natsuru's. Natsuru's voice actor sounds like a really whinny  boy, while his girl sounded fine. I really disliked that fact, because Natsuru really seemed way to young to me for the situation, but maybe that's just me. The rest was fine though.\n
==================Character======================\n
Characters now! For the characters, I enjoyed all of them pretty evenly! I really can't complain, asides Sakura who really segwayed mysteriously throughout the anime. Again though, the main hit to me is Natsuru. Of course, in these animes it requires the protagonists to be the densest person in the world. But, Natsuru was so focused on one girl the entire anime, it really drew away from everything else. I personally loved Shizuku the most, her snarky personality, mysteriousness, power, elegance, everything about her was perfect. But since it's a harem, the main protagonist of course is the biggest idiot in town and then someone who's perfect like her ends up falling for him.\n
================Enjoyment!=======================\n
I really enjoyed this anime, although the negative reviews really didn't give it much credit. The anime supplied tons of humor in multiple ways, along with keeping the main aspect of the Kampfers almost as a side plot. Which to me was alright, but I really wish they would've went into it more\n
================Overall==========================\n
Overall, I'll give this an 8. The enjoyment, art, and characters were wonderful, but the story took alot away from that. The story really didn't focus on the Kampfers, and it kind of destroyed alot for the series. Though, good is to be said for the anime because it really pulled through with the romance and comedy. This anime was really made for people who only enjoy these kind of things though, there really isn't much action involved, so it's better if you preffer harems such as these over that. I really hope this gets a season 2, because if it does, the action is gonna be amazing and everything can come together to finally make sense! :D

Kampfer, huh... I'm not entirely sure WHY I'm so sad this couldn't achieve the absolute heights of awesomeness, or why i like the unique point of this show so much... Well unique as a focus, It's only really a lightly touched point in the pile of things parodied in Twintails. 
Basically, Your regular, underachieving (I'm amazed how they made THAT seem normal), male MC has a nightmare where he is transformed into a girl, and wakes to find the bracelet from his dream on his wrist, with no method of removal. (Again, Someone in these two shows is referencing the other...) Sure enough, the braceletglows and his gender is switched in a Mahou Shojou-style transformation animation.


Pity that their explanation for WHY this is happening, and the details and reason behind the death game, really sucks. Seriously, as soon as they start explaining it, switch off until the comedy or fight scenes come back, because THOSE are where this anime shines. Fortunately, though rather heavy on the ecchi at times (What were you expecting) the jokes are normally really good.


The anime only trips twice, and by that i mean a normal stumble in the middle and the inclusion of a twelfth episode comprised of absolutely none of what makes this anime good. Unless you share the main antagonist's weird love of the entrails animals, that is.


If you want deep, meaningful ANYTHING, stay away. If you want a bit of fun that'll inspire a disturbingly strong curiosity in you, then you're in for a treat.

When I was told about Kämpfer all I was told that it was a guy who sometimes turns into a girl and has to fight other girls. So I didn't have HUGE expectations, but I was still a little disappointing. 
I was told this was an action anime and the action stopped very suddenly and did not pick back up again, I continued to watch, expecting one huge fight scene, but it never came.

This anime is not a serious thing to sit down and watch and get all deep about. Its just a nice, funny little show to make you giggle for 20 minutes each week.

Th-This is a parody right?...LA isn't the only one that think this right?...ok.
Kampfer or Fighter in English for LA really feels like (and LA hopes LA isn't the only one) is a parody of the typical dense main protagonist with a "battle" harem with all the cliches it goes with it (LA just hopes nobody takes Kampfer seriously, otherwise, your watching it for the wrong reasons), the catch?...the main male protagonist Natsuru Senou voiced by Marina Inoue and Marina Inoue is forced to change at will to a girl and has to fight and we have no idea why there fighting..."yay" , harem lesbianhijinks ensues.


Let's start with the characters, well Natsuru is as LA said above your typical dense as a brick main male protagonist who has the hots for Kaede Sakura voiced by Megumi Nakajima, however she likes the "female" side of Natsuru more and the male Natsuru is completely oblivious to the other girls in his harems affections...again typical, but it's where his female side things start to get weird as his harem still wants that crotch in girl form as well and Natsuru being Natsuru is STILL completely oblivious to the blatant flirting that this harem wants him..her...whatever. The one benefit Natsuru has outside the typical main male protagonist is his female side, if not Natsuru (both) could easily rank up there with Ichika Orimura from Infinite Stratos as one of the densest main male protagonist and that is saying something. So what about the harem members?...well we got Kaede the "main love interest" for Natsuru, she's your typical "perfect girl" with a really weird hobby of collecting Entrail Animal plushies and is completely obsessed with the female Natsuru, but she gets a bit more to the plot, not as a typical love interest but something a bit more atypical shown in a typical harem anime. Akane Mishima voiced by Yui Horie, is your typical shy girl (being a librarian further encases her as this), but misunderstands things said to her in a more sexual ways at times, but her Kampfer side is the complete opposite with her being more brash, vindictive and more gun crazy, Akane's Kampfer form was LA's favourite character as Akane's normal form of her shy girl doesn't exactly suit LA. Shizuku Sangou voiced by Kaori Nazuka, the stoic student council president comes in a close second (nearly first...her teasing does cross the line sometimes) for LA in terms of characters as she gets the most development and relationship boost to her and even though her Kampfer side really doesn't change much of her in terms of personality and appearance, her "presence" in the "plot" does move the plot forward for her own and as a side effect Natsuru's benefit as to her questions as to why they are fighting in the first place and by all means Shizuku was probably the only semblance of sense throughout the plot as much a tease she was. Finally rounding up our harem is the childhood friend Mikoto Kondou voiced by Kana Asumi and really she's your typical childhood friend archetype with all the problems that go along with her, sure her quirk is that she rather "physical" with Natsuru and loves curry, but for LA, she came rather late as LA was already vying (either) Natsuru to be with either with Akane or Shizuku by this point. It's also obvious that aside from Kaede, all the other members go BOTH ways for Natsuru. Aside from the main harem casts, there are the talking Entrail Animals who are sorta proxy audience surrogate spectator characters as they are most of them are "meta" mainly with their own characters seiyuu's, likes the crack jokes at Natsuru's expense (and denseness) and really their presences further solidifies Kampfer as a parody and at the same time how useless the Entrails Animal were throughout the plot. LA's favourtie plushy?...Seppuku Kuro Usagi voiced by Yukari Tamura because Yukari Tamura.


As for Kaede Sakura, well she's got some secrets of her own by the final episodes of the anime and the anime CLEARLY and BLATANTLY gives hints to this if your weren't paying attention and really, seeing this, LA actually kinda liked it, sure it digs the "serious tone" and even though  it's more of a tonal whiplash considering all the lesbian harem antics Kampfer gave us in-between all the fighting, but seeing the "bare-boned plot" go into "trying to be playfully serious" is actually kinda refreshing.


Yes...there is MULTIPLE times fanservice occurs in this anime, this anime doesn't have "ecchi" and "shoujo ai" in it's genre pool for no reason and yes, for you yuri fans out there (me included), lavish the fanservice and then be remind constantly that he's a he, but for LA the TRUE fanservice comes in Shizuku x Akane and it's hinted at multiple times in the anime as well albeit teasing on Shizuku's part, misunderstood in Akane's part. Aside from that, yeah expect the girls to be in skimpy outfits and boob-touching for fanservice. Nonetheless the fanservice is either typically overblown and cliche, or yuri as hell.  


In terms of animation by Nomad, the animation is essentially decent throughout but nothing too much to say about, the character designs are candy-colored as ever and the battles are half-way decent for as much "fighting" they do. The animation isn't lackluster due to it's backgrounding as it's color palette on the characters and *ahem* fanservice helps the animation to be at "least" decent enough.


In terms of voice acting, due to the Kampfer forms, essentially the majority of the cast have dual roles (Shizuku's Kampfer being an exception as her tone doesn't change like Akane or Mikoto does) but having the same voice actor, because of this, this voice cast is AMAZING, sure it's typical of Marina Inoue to voice young boys and Natsuru is no exception, but for LA's favourite voice actor it goes easily to Yui Horie because of Akane's two extreme spectrums of shy girl to boisterous "shoot now" personality became an easy win to Yui Horie. The only other surprise to LA was Megumi Nakajima as Kaede.


The ending, well for one the REAL ending is at episode 11, not 12, that episode is a non sequitur, the ending really didn't tell much about why the Kampfers are fighting as well as the "major villain's plans" and the ending ultimately was just left there on a typical "harem ending" and LA by the end of it was left with MORE questions than answers with this ending and as atypical the "major villain is", the presences that left with the ending left just the same as how the major villains retreated by the end of it. Just..."is that it?!?!?!?!?!?"...so yeah LA was more confused than angry at this baffling ending of Kampfer and that final episode (12) didn't help much either.


*Note - LA finished watching "für die Liebe" special episodes and not even those episodes helped as well.


However what Kampfer tries but doesn't care to do is CONTEXT, we do get some semblance of a major villain and harem hijinks and "relationship points" but if you question ANYTHING outside the little bit of plot it has like WHY they are still fighting with each other even after they realize why, why the major villain's plans leads to especially with Natsuru, what's up with Kaede?, what's up with the Entrail Animals giving girls power to turn them into Kampfers like a backstory to them, anything?, who's best girl *cough* Shizuku *cough*, Kampfer really doesn't care to explain to you leading to either being annoying or "look at the yuri ecchi we're throwing at you"...it sorta works but still, it's blatantly obvious Kampfer is more a fight now, explain never in terms of explaining things about the Kampfer (what little we DO get to know). Take this statement like you will but consider that Kampfer is a parody what with it's premise, meta-jokes and character-seiyuu awareness to the typical harem genre.


It is clear be it with Kampfer's obvious flaws and oddly done strengths, that LA had fun with this anime, what with LA seeing Kampfer as a pure genuine parody of the harem genre, the yuri overtones were nothing but a bonus to LA!. Nonetheless Kampfer maybe an odd sit to some people and LA does know the uncanny valley effect this anime has right down to the get go and people might be put off with it's "bare-boned plot, all yuri hijinks", but as LA watched this purely with LA's brain off "most of the time", it was VERY funny to watch seeing this yuri harem hijinks crazy over the dense Natsuru while not caring about the entire reasoning as to why Kampfer fights just "because", just screams it's a parody and NOT to be taken seriously. Fuck it, call it a guilty pleasure for LA (and LA might as well), but LA damn well enjoyed Kampfer for the wrong reasons while still knowing it's blatant flaws and LA is fine with that...


Though the countless amount of times female Natsuru gets "exploited" from MULTIPLE different characters is rather cringy at best and is meant to be taken as comedic relief doesn't help that...

Kampfer is one of those anime you go into expecting it to be stupid. Now that might not be a bad thing, especially not for me. There is something entertaining about watching something that takes a bizarre premise and just rolling with it. However Kampfer fails to fulfill that and ends up being unfunny and legitimately frustrating to watch.  
      Kampfer follows out protagonist Natsuru who has been transformed into Kampfer, a female warrior granted supernatural powers by a stuffed doll. Kampfers are split into two groups blue andred. The two groups must fight each other for some mysterious reason. The first problem I have with this anime is how it thrusts you straight into the plot. Kampfer doesn't set up its world at all nor does it give you time to digest any of the plot. It just skips all the important plot details and goes straight into the action. In the first episode alone I had plenty of questions like: Why do Kampfer exist? Why are they fighting? Why does the main character get chosen to become a Kampfer? Nothing about the nature of Kampfers is explained until much later on and even then its still vague. It wouldn't be so much of a problem, however the most integral plot points all deal with the nature of Kampfers and their reasons for existing. The villains are representative of this problem as they lack any real motivation in this plot because they are so intertwined with restoring the status quo of Kampfers for some great beings that are never properly explained. They don't feel like an actual threat because I have no idea what their stake is in this universe and why they are such a threat. The story tries to be play it off by being mysterious and vaguely philosophical and it doesn't work because you will be too confused to even ponder the reason why any of this is going on. It even tries to throw in a couple plot twists, but they don't work either because they simply just come out of nowhere and it ends up being an excuse to show more girls fighting with each other. The plot takes a backseat for most of the anime so all of this just comes out of nowhere and feels out of place.


     To be fair, I could tell that Kampfer wasn't supposed to be about the plot, but rather the humor of a man who can transform into a girl and how every female near them seems to instantly fall in love with his female form. However this fails to be funny. Most of the humor ends up being forced. Much like the plot, the humor lacks any set up and skips straight to the punchline. Most of the awkward situations that Natsuru is put in(such as buying a bra or wearing a bikini)end up happening because one of the girls in his harem decided to drag them around just because. They were often contrived excuses for jokes and fanservice which lacked any reason to exist. Another fault with this show's humor is its dialogue between characters. Often the interactions between Natsuru and their harem boiled down to Natsuru saying something that could be interpreted as sexual and then that character acting like that they're asking to have sex with them. This was unfunny and it gets old really quickly. 


     The characters themselves are also terrible. The main character is your bog standard extremely dense harem protagonist with no personality. It was really frustrating watching all the girls swoon over Natsuru and seeing how Natsuru was absolutely clueless about why these girls were making all these sexual advances. His female form doesn't save his personality either. Even when he's a girl Natsuru only gains a few new personality traits, mostly acting a bit more awkward than usual, but she acts mostly the same. In fact all the girls, with the exception of one, treat Natsuru the exact same way no matter what form they're in. It ends up being a missed opportunity to create a humorous contrast between how people react to him in guy form and how they react in her girl form. Kampfer really fails to hold up the comedic aspect of its premise. Throughout the entire anime Natsuru even progressively transforms less and less and it ends up losing any of its charm because of it.  


    The other characters aren't any better. Most of the characters are your standard harem cliches, such as the kuudere, dandere, etc, who lack any nuance to their characters at all. They were pretty boring to watch as most of their screen time is dedicated to fighting over Natsuru. None of the characters are compelling and they all just seem to like Natsuru for no real reason at all. I can't even say that they like them for being a nice person because they all fall in love with them at first sight. Its really hard to care or even like most of Natsuru's harem because they are mostly just there for the sake of fanservice, which this anime has a lot of. I don't mind excessive fanservice personally, but I could tell that this anime shoved it in for the sake of having it as a way to keep the viewer engaged, and it doesn't work. 


      There is one minor exception in all these characters and that's Sakura. While she still likes Natsuru for no good reason, unlike the rest of the cast who could love Natsuru despite what form they are in Sakura is only infatuated with the female side. She ends up having a few funny interactions between the two forms of Natsuru, mostly relying on the contrast of her attitudes between male and female Natsuru. She could've fulfilled the promise of creating the joke of an awkaward yuri romance between a purehearted lesbian and man stuck in a girl's body. She could've saved this anime, but Kampfer always did things to make her seem less appealing compared to the other girls, and actively push her away from Natsuru. 


      The animation is also quite bad. A lot of the time the characters movement looked jerky and awkward. Most of the fight scenes were also disappointing as most of them were just one of the girls swinging or firing their weapons a couple times and the fight was usually over. The character designs looked pretty average and I didn't find any of them particularly attractive. The music in Kampfer was surprisingly decent and I kinda liked the OP and ED, but its nothing to write home about.


    Needless to say I thought Kampfer was a train wreck of an anime that didn't fulfill the promise of its premise nor did it make me think about the plot or its characters. I actually might've enjoyed Kampfer if it was so aggressively terrible or even if it had more yuri in it, but it just became another bog standard ecchi harem series.

[THIS REVIEW CONTAINS SPOILERS- read at your own risk]
Kämpfer… oh boy… I had really low expectations to start with, but it still managed to be extremely underwhelming experience in the end. 
Mostly because the last episode (12th) was just a weird filler…  and the story (if you can even call it ”story”) had no conclusion at all. I fully expected that most of those questions every viewer has after the first episode will not be answered, but I didn’t expect that they add more questions in the last episodes and then left them unanswered as well, leaving nothing but feelings of bewilderment and frustration.


Story 2/10

Natsuru Sejou is a male high school student that suddenly gains ability to transform into a girl and become Kämpfer, female fighter, sort of magical girl. Information about his new powers is provided by creepy talking plush doll harakiri Tiger (which really looks like a sort of cutesy version of tiger that has performed seppuku). Tiger is one of the messengers of mysterious moderators who have selected Natsuru to be Kämpfer, and since Kämpfers for some reason need to be female(for reasons only moderators know) so does Natsuru change gender when his powers are activated. All Kämpfers have a messenger that is talking and moving creepy plush doll that depicts some dead animal with guts hanging from their stomach(even though they are each died in a different manner, some stabbed, some hanged, some burnt alive), sick humour but I kinda liked the absurdity of these plush dolls, the Entrails Animals as their franchise is called. What they have to do with Kämpfers though… only moderators know. They all have rather famour Seiyuus voicing them and they joke about that quite a lot.  Anyways back to main Kämpfer, Natsuru has a blue ring in his/her wrist to symbolize that he is part of the blue Kämpfers who fight against the red Kämpfers, for reasons only moderators know. Natsuru has the power of magic or Zauber, other types of Kämpfers are Schwert(Sword) and Gewehr(firearms), and as everything related to kämpfers they are in German for reasons only moderators know…  


Okay you are seeing a pattern here, Moderators know everything, but as you can probably guess nothing is ever answered. Despite that obvious senselessness premise is actually pretty good IMHO. I wholeheartedly expected that this show has a simple and stupid plot that doesn’t develop and is just an excuse to show cute girls fighting each other a lot with magical abilities. This expectation was totally wrong. Plot surely is stupid though, but they actually try to develop it during the last episodes and it only gets worse from there…. and fighting, this show is named Kämpfer yet there is very very little fighting. It’s almost non-existent. Most of the time protagonist doesn’t even fight back, yet in the end he/she is suddenly the best fighter for some reason. 


Art 8/10

This is the main reason to watch this show, it looks good. Girls (including Natsuru) are cute and have a nice figure, animation is rather smooth and transformations are cool. Fights are rare but look pretty nice as well. There is a lot of fanservice and that’s mainly very good, especially yuri-scenes. If that’s your thing and you don’t care about fights, chaarcter development, romance or actual plot, there is this ”plot” pretty much. 


Sound 7/10

Voice acting is overall very good. Entrails animals especially are well acted. Music is nothing especially memorable though, but works well enough. It looks good and sounds pretty good too.


Characters 4/10

This is the weak point. Especially Natsuru Senou, he/she is a very weak even for a protagonist character. Not in terms of fighting, but as being memorable or meaningful. This is usual problem in harem/ecchi comedies. Protagonist is extremely dense and stupid, usually pretty weak and pathetic too, but he still gets all the girls. This was sort of expected, but even for a harem protagonist Natsuru is one-dimensional. He(she) has no hobbies, no personality, no family and no interests besides the girl he is infatuated with: Sakura Kaede. 

Sakura appears to be friendly and cute, school idol beauty. She is not interested at all in Natsuru when he is guy, but falls in love with female Natsuru. Later it’s revealed she is some sort of evil manipulator, not kämpfer, but she has something to do with moderators and she has a harem of girl lovers that are also white kämpfers that punish rebellious kämpfers or something. Her motivation is completely mystery to me however, she seems to be lesbian, apparently hates men, but wants Natsuru as female, still she manipulates male Natsuru to have sex with Shizuku, for some reason, even though that fails… later she wants that Natsuru kills his/her kämpfer friends…. I don’t get it at all what she wants. That entire Sakura-thing was such a stupid plot twist IMO. And despite all this Natsuru in the end has eyes only for Sakura…. how can someone be that dense….. 

There are two characters I kinda cared about, Akane Mishima and Shizuku Sangou. Akane is shy meganekko with somewhat dirty imagination and she accidentally says ambiguous sexual things and gets flustered by her own words. When Akane turns into Kämpfer her personality changes (for reasons moderators would possibly know) as well as her looks, she has no more  glasses and her hair turns from orange to bright red. She becomes aggressive and swears a lot when shooting with her pistol. She is Gewehr-type Kämpfer in blue team like Natsuru. Shizuku is beautiful and smart student council president, but appears to be rather cold, calculating and bossy. Shizuku is in red team but refuses to fight and is interested in what moderators are up to. Her appearance changes only little with her hair shining a bit, she is Schwert-type kämpfer.

Third (or fourth if you count Natsuru as girl)Kämpfer girl is Natsuru’s tomboyish childhood friend Mikoto Kondou, who has travelled a lot and loves to make curry to Natsuru. She was sort of irritating to be honest. She is typical overly energetic character and of course in love with Natsuru as well. Her appearance changes, but her personality remains almost same when she turns into Schwert-type kämpfer. When show starts she travels around the world and sends postcards to Natsuru, that was kind of fun recurring theme, but when she returns home and becomes kämpfer she is often just plain irritating extra character that show didn’t even really need IMO. She has some… interesting moments with Akane though…. 

Then there is harem of evil lesbians, white kämpfers, who seem to be all sort of archetypes, loli, sadist, tsundere etc. but these baddies are poor fighters so they don’t serve any purpose really…. they just are there with Sakura-sama. Useless characters without any purpose really. 

Male Natsuru has some male friend who likes to take photos of hotties (including female Natsuru) but that’s pretty much it what comes to human characters. Then there are Entrails animals, Harakiri Tiger, Black Seppuku Bunny, Electrocuted Wildcat, Strangled Stray Dog and Burnt alive Lion, who are messengers of Kämpfers for some reason. They do all sort of weird things, talk, eat and drink and move but are still not really alive apparently…. They are crazy concept but kind of fun self-assertive craziness. In episode 12, which is Christmas special they steal kämpfer’s bodies turning them into Kemonomimi girls and go to have fun in the town while kämpfers are trapped in their plush doll bodies. 


Enjoyment 5/10

First episodes were enjoyable but ”ending” was so bad it kinda ruined the mood. Episode 12 was a fine filler on it’s own and made no sense at all, but for all those who didn’t understand that episode 11 is the end of it, ep 12 came as unexpected surprise that feels like cruel joke to all those who expected some sort of conclusion or explanation what the hell actually happened in the entire show. Only moderators know and yes we never get to meet them, I guess…. unless Sakura is moderator which I think she is not, but since nothing is never explained I don’t know…. and I don’t care.  


Overall 5/10


Idea was nice and non-sensical, but there were too little fighting and no character-development at all. It was all fan-service and ecchi comedy. Still there was very little comedy about the gender swapping in the end. Despite awesome opportunity with actually physically gender swapping protagonist, they pretty much fail to use his/her ability to do any actually funny scenes with it.

sound: to me it was an average sounding show
character:  towards the end is where they got good and there where some turns I didnt think that would happen
enjoyment: for me nothing really stood out.
so overall i gave it a 7

When I first started Kämpfer I hadn't got the slightest idea as to what it would be about. So after the first episode I was a bit surprised. Kämpfer is an ecchi shoujo-ai/comedy/action anime, and because I had never seen an other ecchi series before, I just had to get used to it a bit. Right from the start of this anime I was slightly puzzled because you don't know why things are the way they are. It is just a fact, no explanation. At the 11th episode there is some sort of conclusion as to why things are happening,but still, the storyline is a bit vague. The art is really outstanding. I love the way it is drawn, very detailed; really a pleasure for the eye ^^. The characters were good. Most of them though have flat personalities, but some of the characters' personalities change in ways you would not expect. As I already said, there is definitely some humour in this anime. Not a lot but just enough to make it a bit more enjoyable. Overall I first wanted to give it a 9, but I didn't. Why? Because the last two episodes were a bit disappointing. The forelast episode is actually the last episode, because the story is "concluded" there. And what annoyed me was that at the most exciting moment in the story, where the music should have been exciting fighting music, the music was some sort of weird German happy childish song. That really spoiled the moment for me. And the last episode in fact does not make sense at all. You'd expect the story to be brought to a nice, sense-making end there, but in fact that episode does not add anything to the story at all. But still overall I looked forward to every episode, even though the last two episodes were a bit of a shame.

In all honesty, when i first started watching this, I didnt think it would be that great. I knew I would be entertained by this anime for a while but besides that I wasnt expecting much. I was very much surprised when I found I had become hooked to the series. And itsnot because this series is extremely original or innovative. Instead, Kampfer keeps up a great sense of humour (although lewd at times I was always laughing) as well as a story which seems to get deeper and deeper the more you watch it. I wasnt convinced at the starting the story would be much but as we are getting into some of the later episodes it seems to be getting stronger. As for the characters, they really are by the books, the shy glasses, the strong willed student council and the eccentric childhood friend, but the characters themselves seem to be growing and evolving giving them another layer which is a nice addition. \n\n
The art and animation is well done for this anime and I particularly like the sound that they used, its up beat when it needs to be and soft when needed. I do recommend this to anyone who likes these types of animes, it is definitely a cut above the rest. I give this a solid 9.

Who here likes ecchi filled, somewhat funny, kind of annoying anime with a case of ADD? Then Kampfer is the perfect anime for you.
Story: What's good about the story in Kampfer is, when it focuses on the story, it's good. The problem here is, it rarely focuses on the story. It strays away from the story faster than you can say "Attention Deficient Disorder" in order to present you with ecchi and goofy things. Grated sometimes these goofy things can be funny, but most of the time it's crap. Now, when it focuses on the story, it really does a good job. The fighting isreally fun to watch and the story is interesting, but that doesn't mean it's flawless. It uses padding of ecchi and goofy things to prolong the plot and when we get the answers we need to understand the story, it's too late. We don't get all the answers we need either. The worst thing about the plot is, it has potential, but it doesn't use it all. It taps it a bit, but it didn't reach it's full potential.


Characters: The characters in Kampfer are OK as well. Akane and Mikoto are probably the best characters, even though they do try and whore themselves out. I can actually care about them, most of the time anyways. Natsuru is OK, but he's a giant dumb-ass. Seriously, he's as stupid as a rock that just had a lobotomy. He understands nothing. Shizuku is also OK but she's too controlling. Like really TOOOOOO controlling. She's a puppet master of a puppet master. And she doesn't need to be. It's extremely unnecessary and she does it anyway in an over-the-top fashion. Sakura is generic at first but then turns into a rip-off of Mesdusa from Soul Eater. Who is also a bad character. She rips-off an already bad character to become an even worse character. The Entrails animals are kind of fun to watch, but are also annoying. Especially in the last episode. But an anime can't be all bad when you have a character named "Disemboweled Tiger". The characters are just all around OK. They need a little work but, it can be worse as well.


Art: You know in most reviews, when people complain about the art, they usually say "it needs more money" or "They didn't put enough effort in it" stuff like that. Well, in Kampfer, it's the opposite. They put too much effort into it and it looks bad because of it. It's saying "PLEASE PAY ATTENTION TO US! WE WANT YOU TO PAY ATTENTION TO US!" and it just fails epically. It's not all bad, but for the most part, it just sucks.


Sound: The voices are pretty decent. I mean, they can be obnoxious at times, but it works for the most part. The OST is really good. I could feel it when I heard it. It has an amazing impact on the viewer and it just works.


Overall: As I said before, Kampfer has potential, but it gets drawn back because of it's goofy ecchi crap, obnoxious tendencies, and poor art. It can be entertaining at times, but if you're doubting about watching this anime, then I would say you shouldn't. On the other side, if you want to, go ahead and go for it. Kampfer was just decent experience for me, and nothing more. 6/10

I've been meaning to review this for a while. It's one of the worst anime I have ever seen. For a while I had wanted to write this, and I actually erased this since I didn't think it was good, so this is my second time writing it. Ultimately, Kämpfer is terrible. I guess there will be spoilers for the smidgen of story this show had. So, I'll tell you why it was terrible now, in part by part.
/STORY- 2 NON-EXISTANT PLOT LINES OUTTA 10\
Uh, what story? By that I mean, Kämpfer apparently doesn't have one. I mean, I guess it does, but also doesn't?Allow me to explain. A group of alien stuffed animals turn people into powerful warriors. Then they fight. Now dear reader, you might be thinking, "Why are they fighting?" Well, actually, there's no reason. They just are. And then, at the last episode, we get a 30 second explanation that goes no where. And, because of that, it brings about the entire shows downfall. You need to have a story to keep people engaged. This was one of those shows that really could have benefited from a second season despite being bad, because the whole show felt like a set up for something bigger that didn't happen. Like, maybe we could see the main characters going into space to fight those aliens that made them fight for no apparent reason? I think it would have been more satisfying.


But hey, that's just the backstory. The actual story is just as bad. Some uninteresting dude gets turned into a Kämpfer overnight and he must fight the others and ALSO team up with the others for no apparent reason like I said. There's just one little twist. Most of the Kampfers are feminists or something (/joke) so they aren't too keen on a male Kampfer for... some ... reason. But oh no, one of the enemy Kämpfers falls in love with him. Generic shinamigans ensue. You know how like, in the Simpsons, at the end of every episode, it just kinda 'resets'? Well, this show dies the same thing.


Speaking of other shows, you know the Power Rangers? I think this show was pretty much trying to be the Power Rangers, just if one day the Power Rangers went crazy and started killing EACH OTHER instead of the bad guys. 


The genre of this show is one that is very disputable... it's definitely ecchi, but also a yuri. And of course, 'action' if you like action with minimal reason. Now, the former of those first two I'm not crazy about- I only watch them if they are apparently great. The ladder of the two I like much more (still not my favorite). So, if you enjoy any of these 3 I guess I recommend the show. Unfortunately for me though, I had to watch this show in 10-minute intervals or else I felt like my head was going to explode or heart would stop.


/ART- 3 DULL COLORS OUTTA 10\n

The art I'd say, is a good reflection of the show. Trying to be colorful and new, but still super dull nonetheless. This show had a close-to-HD-but-not-quite vibe, which I didn't really like. The style actually reminded me of Attack on Titan a little in the respect that it looked as if the characaters had been "pasted in" if you know what I mean. Except that show actually had some quality in it's animation.


/SOUND- 3 HORRIBLE TRACKS OUTTA 10\n

The OP is so forgettable it's not even funny. This was probably because I started skipping after the 3rd episode since it gave me a headache everytime I watched it. The visuals for the OP literally have nothing to with the show. Seriously, nothing that happens in the OP actually happens in the show. Now, the ED is just as bad. The music is just as forgettable. As for the visuals, it defied the laws of physics. Look it up, it's definitely laughable.


/CHARCATER- 5 'BEST PART' OUTTA 10\n

The characters were also terrible for this show. They were the best part though, which is still terrible. I feel no need to go ver each one like I usually do. There was the blue hair guy who pretty much everyone hates except for the crazy girl. Crazy girl has her own weird harem who act like vampires or something. Then there was the red hair girl who is also insane and swears every two seconds. Then there was the student president, who seemed like she was the one who was least nuts and kinda smart but she kinda got sucked into it too. There, there's the 'characters'.


/ENJOYMENT- 4 OUTTA 10\n

So did I enjoy this show? No, not really. It wasn't even laughable either. It was less then "eh" in every respect. It was kinda weird and different though, so there was that. It wasn't as typical as other stuff I guess.


/OVERALL- 4 OUTTA 10\n

This website says a 4 is 'decent'. That's probably because it's the word that describes this show best. Decent. It's pretty bad- atrocicus even. But I know there are people out there who will like it. So, do I recommend it? No, only if you liked the stuff you read in this review. If you did, go for it. 


Thanks for reading!

I watched dozens of anime, but I never felt so ferocious about one...
Story: Error 404 - story not found. I really don't have to mention this, but if you're looking for an ecchi/"harem" anime with some story just quit. It has no story at all. Just a boy turning into agirl called Kämpfer and fighting other Kämpfer. He meets other girls and they start falling in love with him (SPOILER: Except Sakura, I think she was just acting to like girls). The fight between blue and red stops because of Shizuku and then another team appears (SPOILER: under Sakura's leadership as it seems). They all hate those moderators, which never appeared... But it's all ok. For me a harem anime doesn't need to have a story, there can just be some eye-candy and a lot of hot scenes and I'm pleased. But the last episode angered me. What did we get in the last episode. !!SPOILERS!! They all switched their bodies with their plushies (those animals annoyed me in the first place, right from the start of the anime, they were so freaking annoying...) and what happens.
